comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Is this required in JEE? If not, remove. If it is, there is a copy & paste typo there with the jsp name. If the page does not exist yet, then leave empty

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: New JEE6 way of implmentation made now. This part is removed from the config file. CatastropheMaintenancePage is added now with the prefect changes to the listner.

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Copy & Paste typo with the Secured Action Name i.e. _"FO_TASKTYPE_ROLE_ADMIN_

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: It was known and the commit was done to make the dependency resolved for the other activities. Correct Secured Action is yet to be created, but the name is identified and used correctly now.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: I know its probably copying existing code, but why hard code the FQN of CatastropheMaintenanceListener? Why not use CatastropheMaintenanceListener.class.getName()?? In this way, if it moves package, this will just work without change

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: Yes, it was a copy paste to see things working.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Dont use such short variable names. Whats wrong with widgetContainer? Its so much more descriptive than wc, which actually means toilet :-)

comments.comment: Same as above - missing Copyright

comments.comment: As per the new JEE6 implementation, removed this class now.

comments.comment: & javadoc

comments.author: Mahendra Dash

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Javadoc is incorrect - this is not related to the _process version validation page_

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: As per the new JEE6 implementation, removed this class now.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: JSPs should all be lower case, as per existing FINEOS standards. Rename catastropheMaintenancePage to catastrophemaintenancepage

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: We decided to keep the name of the jsp's to Java class names with first letter small. This is as per the new JEE 6 refcard guidelines. If in this code base we have to do it as you said, then we will do it. Please let me know if it is mandaory to have as you said.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Use tabs to format JSP to make it easier to read, similar to java. Not a big issue here, but when JSPs grow, you want indentation.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: Used the standard formating (Ctr Shift + F). Hope that helps.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: @Since FFO-1234

comments.comment: Same as below

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: @Since FFO-1234 missing

comments.author: Mahendra Dash

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: I cant see CatastropheMaintenancePage, but Im going to guess it must call init() on the widget. This is not tested, whereas the simple getter is. We should focus testing effort on code that is actually written, rather than auto generated get/set

reviewTimeLines.summary: FCM-2829 FFO-39999: Code changes to place the \'areasAffectedMultiSelectEnumWidget\' on the Add Catastrophe page

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment:
Not related to your changes, but pages are generally called Add<BOName>Page.java / .jsp. i.e. AddCatastrophePage.java / addcatastrophepage.jsp.
The word Details is generally used for widgets

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: This should be as follows <div class="PagePanel">

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Comments in JSP should be <%-- as follows --%> The comments you did are for HTML and will appear in the genetated HTML, not good

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Dont do this. Inline styling is bad. You shouldnt need to do this just for a widget

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: JEE you dont need to specify URL, it should be deduced as the same path as the java widget

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: We dont use OC any more in BO names.

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Same comment as above re: naming of java / jsp for a Page

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: This comment is not providing anything extra that you can't decipher from the code, so remove.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Constructr not required, provided by java

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Comment is now incorrect, there is no loner inline style.
Just FYI, we generally dont stuff like this. If there is a styling issue, we should raise FDP issue to get it fixed across the board.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: dont use url attribute

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: This issue was not Resolved - you didnt do a code change. In this scenario, you should click "Drop" and provide a comment of why. I assume it was dropped since the JSP widget is not the same paclage as the java class. You cant just drop a comment without justification.

reviewTimeLines.summary: FCM-2829 FFO-39999: New handler and widget classes for Multiselectenum resolver for Areas affected

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: To make the variable easier to read / understand, I would just call it catastrophe. We're trying to make the code read easier with actual words

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Same comment as above re: readability, so I'd update this to getCatastrophe

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Same comment as before re: readability, so remove oc, & just call the variables catastrophe

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: We don't need loggers in JEE, so you can remove this. I know there's a lot of this in the codebase you're working off, but that's Claims, which has been migrated to JEE, so existing legacy code still has this.

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: I've seen a few examples where this is required (including one of my own! :), but generally that is a special case. Is this actually required?

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Why did you remove the init method? This is required, my question was in relation to the use of the initialised variable

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: This has since been deleted in http://iedev317.development.fineos.com/reviewboard/r/62655/

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Dont use "magic numbers" like 1897465L. You should use the enum constant definnitions for referencing full IDs

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Is this cast needed? I would assume OCAreasAffected implements MultiSelectEnumResolver, so it shouldnt be

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: As above re magic numbers

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: No need for this method. Setting things back to null is not required. They're just re-assigned in the @Before anyway
